alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 8:00AM CDT until July 11 at 4:20AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Approximately 5 thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to 3 feet... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Depths may be greater at locations where small streams enter the Washita River valley below Clinton. Some farmsteads are flooded and others isolated by water over local roads. Low farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 800 PM CDT.
